body.p:
I am without any of
your favors by the steamer which
arrived on the 31st Ulto. Perhaps your
letters are with the parcel of Occidents
which again may be in some case of ?
not yet opened. I leave possibly on
the 9th just for St. Thomas, and have accordg.
to your wishes handed over all your books
to Mr. Michael De Cordova, Bookseller,
who being in good bus?p, and his
shop much resorted to, will be the
best person to protect your interests.
I have agreed with him on your behalf
for 23 pCent ? for his
labor which you will please confirm.
Whatever I can do for you in St. Thomas

I will to the utmost of my power.
by the last accounts from St. Thomas
the Gov. Gen. Had not yet conferred
my appointment, notwithstanding
my election having been unanimous
and the contract, the great bane of
contention, having been carried by an
large majority (in confidence 26 to 8)
owing to this petty faction, opposed
to the engagement of any minister
having complained to the G. G. of
some irregularity or precipitancy
in the carrying of the Gaul Meeting.
If the English packet expected tomorrow with the St. Thomas's mail, should not bring the expected confirma-
tion, I shall still go on the 9th; and

know the reason why I will
write you are particulars from
St. Thomas. I apprehend no refusal
of the Gov: Gen: for he and I are old
friends and he wants me there.
However disappointments & difficulties
may arise and who knows whether
I may not yet pay you a visit
at Philadelphia. You saw something
in Mr. Joseph Abraham's letter to us
which you did not want to see. What
will you say to my informing you that
the individual in question has the
same reputation every where he has
been to? The Jewish Ministry in America
and the W. J. is so easy ? that all
persons who can manage to attain a
learning hearing either from Reading Desk or

pulpit obtain engagements and I
will present myself to say of the party
in question is that in the absence of being
able to report any thing good, I will not
pen any thing bad. Hebrew I have as yet
no acknowledgment of my letter containing
so many items of information about St.
Thomas
Curaçao. Have you received it?
I beg you will on receipt of this write
to Mr. Joseph Abrahams, Cincinnati, informing
him how matters stand with me and
St. Thomas at present. If my engagement
there be or be not concluded I will write him.

Would that I could write congratulate
you and every one in the States, with the
words Hebrew; but though ultimate
good must result from this unnatural,
sanguinary, and heart sickening contest
it is apparently so very remote that
many on that soil will sink into the
grave and be forgotten before the

jubilant? sounds be heard Hebrew
Hebrew! A former pupil resident for the
last 6 years in N. O. arrived here a few
days back, and gave me a deplorable
account of the condition of my late
congregation there. Gutheim?, poor fellow,
is at Augusta, Ga. with his wife's family.
Who would have thought 13 years ago
that witnessed Judah Touro's signature
to her noble deed of gift, or saw him laying
the foundation stone, that the worshippers
would all be gone from the sacred house
and that Hebrew. Nothing is
certain but God, death, and Eternity.
Your late articles in the Occident are written with much vigor and p?. I
read them with pleasure and profit.
Our colonial Jews, particularly in
Jamaica are crying out loudly of there
being no Jewish Boarding School in
England where they can place their
children. They do not like any there; and

many of the British Jews complain of the same
thing. A great many would like me to
start such an establishment, but I would
not attempt it without ? receiving
help in money, and the certainty of
a good number of pupils. One thing
is certain. If I go to the end of the
world, I will no longer stay in this
brutalizing heart and soul debasing
spot, where the forms of religion are
in some measure outwardly observed,
but the Hebrew, especially as relating
Hebrew, are utterly disregarded.

Mention us to all old friends
especially Miss Gratz, Miss Louisa
Hart & family, and Mr. Abraham
Hart & family. May the prayers of
you all be heard before the Eternal
Throne and your names inscribed
Hebrew. Mrs N sends her love.Your friend
